metadata.title: CVE-2019-19065 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** A memory leak in the sdma_init() function indrivers/infiniband/hw/hfi1/sdma.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.9 allowsattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by triggeringrhashtable_init() failures, aka CID-34b3be18a04e. NOTE: This has beendisputed as not a vulnerability because "rhashtable_init() can only fail ifit is passed invalid values in the second parameter's struct, but wheninvoked from sdma_init() that is a pointer to a static const struct, so anattacker could only trigger failure if they could corrupt kernel memory (inwhich case a small memory leak is not a significant problem)."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-gcp - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-oracle - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1007-oem - 5.4.0-1002.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-9.12').
linux-kvm package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1004.4').
linux-aws package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1005.5').
linux-azure package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1006.6').
linux-gcp package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1005.5').
linux-oracle package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1005.5').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-oem-5.6 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1002.4').
